StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_UpdateSMCR]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@SMCRID int = 0, @ContractID int, @Ac.vated char(1), @Ac.vatedDate date.me, @Deac.vatedDate date.me = NULL, @UserLogin varchar(15), @ID int = 0 OUTPUT AS
IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM SMCR WHERE SMCR_ID = @SMCRID) BEGIN UPDATE SMCR SET CONTRACT_ID = @ContractID, ACTIVATED = @Ac.vated, ACTIVATED_DATE = @Ac.vatedDate, DEACTIVATED_DATE = @Deac.vatedDate, USER_LOGIN = @UserLogin, UPDATE_DATE = GETDATE() WHERE SMCR_ID = @SMCRID
--- RETURN THE SMCR ID SET @ID = @SMCRID END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO SMCR (CONTRACT_ID, ACTIVATED, ACTIVATED_DATE, DEACTIVATED_DATE, USER_LOGIN, UPDATE_DATE) VALUES (@ContractID, @Ac.vated, @Ac.vatedDate, @Deac.vatedDate, @UserLogin, GETDATE())
--- RETURN THE SMCR ID SET @ID = @@IDENTITY END
